bug.author: mallela
bug.summary: [0.9.5] OverflowError: Python int too large to convert to C long
bug.description: I get the following error when I run manual_contorl.py from the pre-built release: OverflowError: Python int too large to convert to C long at line 416 'Simulation time: % 12s' % datetime.timedelta(seconds=int(self.simulation_time)), Has anyone encountered this issue?

comments.comment: Simulation time is a double internally, it might be too big to pass as an int to datetime.
I identified the problem - I had not added the correct .egg to the PYTHONPATH. I added the one for 0.9.4 instead of 0.9.5. Works now!
Oh ok, great! I'll close the issue then :)
